title: Ticket #7316: Poor performance from curl_plugin
description:
I noticed very poor performance when downloading a file using the curl_plugin. Notably, while the transfer was going at O(10 MB/s), the process was pegged at 100% CPU utilization -- way below the capabilities of curl.

Unfortunately, it appears we got hit by this bug:

https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/cacdc27f52

(which is not patched in RHEL7), which causes significant performance degradation / significant CPU utilization when low speed timeouts are used.
remarks:
2019-Oct-18 13:27:49 by coatsworth:
The bug was patched in newer versions of libcurl. Brian suggested that we add a version check before setting the low-speed timeouts, similar to what xrootd does here:

https://github.com/xrootd/xrootd/blob/51fe860af8007e4541c17d6f189db027c6bbcc22/src/XrdTpc/XrdTpcState.cc#L75-L82

A more robust solution would be to use callbacks to abort the transfer if it's taking too long, but that's too big a change to squeeze in post code-freeze. So for now we're using the version check, and expect to implement the full fix into the 8.9.5 release.
